channel.title: Rscd on linux!
channel.description: Well, i'm having a small problem with setting up the server on linux.. I've set upa demonik server piss easy, just need a runme file with paths to java apache, then ant demonikp2p, easy as pie.. Rscd is not so simple plus you have lserver and runserver.. Anybody managed to pull this off? give me a hint or 2.

item.title: Rscd on linux!
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Uhg, i think i’m going to give up.

i made a runme1.sh runme2.sh

Put the paths

ant compile
ant runls

same for runme2 but ant runserver

Then made runthis.sh with it saying inside

sh runme1.sh > log_ls bla bla for servers
sh runme2.sh > log_serv bla bla
echo “running!”

i type ./runthis.sh it says running!, but server doesn’t go online :\

Read full topic

item.title: Rscd on linux!
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Ahh, i did exactly that, an got the same error as i did the other way i tried it hm. Something to do with my java.

Read full topic

item.title: Rscd on linux!
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Yup, like I said. If you know how to use the operating system it wouldn’t be hard… You’re gonna have real trouble running a server on there if you don’t even know how to use the OS tbh…

I’ll help you anyway though…

nano filename.sh
Now paste your commands in this file, the export and ant etc crap.
ctrl + x then enter to save the file...
chmod +x filename.sh, at the command line to make the file executable
./filename.sh

That is the unix equivilent to a batch file. But seriously, use windows if you don’t know what you’re doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Rscd on linux!
item.dc:creator: @BuyMyJunk BuyMyJunk
item.description:
@BuyMyJunk wrote:

java -cp rscd.jar;. org.rscdaemon.server.Server

that might work i used something similar to runclients, never tried servers with it
so worth a shot

Read full topic

item.title: Rscd on linux!
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

I’ve got a runnable server, it’s just like since linux cannot run batch files, you need a new file somthing similiar to runme…? then it has java apache paths.

So i need to how to actually RUN the server.

With demonik it was a case of:

export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0/bin:/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06/bin;
export JAVA_HOME="/usr/local/jdk1.6.0_06"
export ANT_HOME="/usr/local/apache-ant-1.7.0"
ant compile
ant runserver & runls > log_server 2>&1 &(this bit just 2 log commands ect not really essential).

Read full topic
